newsitem.title: DUBAI: BCCI first payout in December - UAE bank governor.
newsitem.headline: BCCI first payout in December - UAE bank governor.

text.p: First payment to depositors and creditors of the failed Bank of Credit and Commerce International (BCCI) will be made in December, the United Arab Emirates central bank governor was quoted on Monday as saying.
"First payment will be made to depositors and creditors worldwide at the same time" UAE newspapers quoted Central Bank governer Sultan al-Suweidi as saying.
"The payout will range between 15 and 18 percent of total sums owed to depositors," he said.
Officials and bankers close to the case were not immediately available for comments.

BCCI, which was founded in 1972 in Luxembourg, was closed by central banks in 1991 and collapsed with debts of more than $12 billion on total deposits of $20 billion when evidence of huge fraud and money laundering was unearthed. Depositors have been fighting to recoup their losses ever since.

Liquidators of the failed bank in May said an agreement with the majority shareholder, the Abu Dhabi government, in which Abu Dhabi would pay $1.8 billion into a pool for distribution to creditors and depositors was a major step towards paying a first dividend to about 250,000 BCCI creditors worldwide.
Along with the UAE where about 45,000 creditors are owed nearly five billion dirhams ($1.34 billion), the largest concentration of creditors is in Britain.
